_header: This month of May withouten peer princess
Subjects: roundels; lovers, addresses to beloved; May, songs of
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, a roundel, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 31) — 14 lines

BLHar682.First Lines:
THis monthe of may withouten pere princesseThe sovl plesere of all
                    myn hope & thouȝt…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…Ye haue myn hert yn al ye may or oughtSo ordeyne me a lady
                    and maystres
BLHar682.Note: As written, repeats first words of lines 1-2 at end to indicate going back to first four lines of the roundel.
BLHar682.Facsimiles:
